qas.question: During what war did French officers setup headquarters in CAR?
Who was elected in 1946 as the first representative?
How many votes did Boganda get?
What was Bogandas platform that he ran for?
What caused Boganda to leave his elected post?

answers.text: disheartened with the French political system

qas.question: Where did the Ubangi-Shari establish their headquarters?
Who was elected in 1950 to become the first CAR representative in the French government?
How many votes did General Leclerc get in the election?

plausible_answers.text: against racism and the colonial regime

qas.question: What was the political position of General Leclerc?

plausible_answers.text: the Movement for the Social Evolution of Black Africa

qas.question: What did Barthelemy Boganda establish in September 1940?

context: In September 1940, during the <a0_0>Second World War<a0_0/>, pro-Gaullist French officers took control of Ubangi-Shari and General Leclerc established his headquarters for the Free French Forces <b5_0>in Bangui<b5_0/>. In 1946 <a1_0><b6_0>Barthélémy Boganda<b6_0/><a1_0/> was elected with <a2_0><b7_0>9,000 votes<b7_0/><a2_0/> to the French National Assembly, becoming the first representative for CAR in the French government. Boganda maintained a <a3_0>political stance <b8_0>against racism<a3_0/> and the colonial regime<b8_0/> but gradually became <a4_0>disheartened with the French political system<a4_0/> and returned to CAR to establish <b9_0>the Movement for the Social Evolution of Black Africa<b9_0/> (MESAN) in 1950.
